meanings.definition: A distressing experience or situation that occurs while one is awake.
meanings.sent1: The daymare of failing the test kept him up at night.
meanings.sent2: She couldn't shake off the daymare of getting lost in the unfamiliar city.
meanings.sent3: The daymare of forgetting her lines in the school play made her practice even harder.
meanings.sent4: The daymare of being alone in a crowded room felt suffocating.
meanings.sent5: The daymare of falling from a great height woke him up in a cold sweat.

meanings.definition: A frightening or unpleasant dream experienced while awake.
meanings.sent1: The daymare of being chased by a monster haunted her thoughts.
meanings.sent2: He couldn't tell if the shadow in the corner was real or just a daymare.
meanings.sent3: The daymare of missing the bus to work made him rush out the door.
meanings.sent4: The daymare of being trapped in a dark forest felt all too real.
meanings.sent5: The daymare of losing her way in the foggy woods made her heart race.
